value: Aust in the 1960s, while the ferry was still in use and the bridge under construction

Aust's importance has dwindled twice over time. Back before the first severn bridge was constructed in the 1960s the village had lots of visitors on the old Aust ferry service. The second "bypassing" of it came when the second severn crossing was built in the 1990s and most of the reasons to visit Aust today is interest in the river severn itself and to see the history of the remains of the aust ferry and first severn bridge.
The best way in is via the Motorway, M48. Local travellers can also get here via the minor routes A403 or B4461.
Cross the severn bridge, which can be crossed on foot.
As a site of motorway service station, there is most of shopping available at the services there.
, a small cottage that provides some rural accommodation away from the service station.
The service station provides wifi for customers.
